meanings.definition: To arrange data or information in a tabular form.
meanings.sent1: She tabbed the numbers neatly in columns.
meanings.sent2: He always tabs his notes to keep them organized.
meanings.sent3: The data was tabbed so perfectly, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her mind tabbed the information like a well-organized filing cabinet.
meanings.sent5: Tabbing the details made the report easy to read and understand.

meanings.definition: To mark or identify with a tab.
meanings.sent1: He tabbed the important pages with colorful sticky notes.
meanings.sent2: She tabbed the recipe she wanted to try later.
meanings.sent3: The detective tabbed the key evidence in the case file.
meanings.sent4: His memory tabbed the moment as a significant turning point.
meanings.sent5: Tabbing the map with landmarks helped them navigate the city easily.

meanings.definition: To open a new tab in a web browser.
meanings.sent1: She tabbed a new page to search for information online.
meanings.sent2: He tabbed multiple websites to compare prices.
meanings.sent3: The student tabbed various resources for the research project.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity tabbed new tabs like opening doors to different worlds.
meanings.sent5: Tabbing quickly between tabs made multitasking effortless.
